intro: Scorzonera tunicata, commonly known as the tunicate scorzonera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its hairy, tubular leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant produces a bulbous root system that is often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Scorzonera tunicata is known for its resilience in harsh environments and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
